main event: On October 19, 1959, an observer in the Republic of Korea reported sighting a crescent-shaped silver object moving very slowly toward the west.
interesting points: The object was described as approximately the size of the letter 'C' on a penny held at arm's length., The sighting lasted for three hours and twenty minutes., The observer noted very exact data on the bearing and altitude of the object., It was suggested in the report that the object was likely the planet Venus., The exact position of Venus matched the reported position of the object.
